channel.title: Aston
channel.description:
I don't post in here very often, but I came across this group several weeks ago. They're graduates and soon-to-be graduates from Sydney Australia's Conservatorium of Music, which is basically the most prestigious music school we have.
So far they've done classical arrangements for a number of pop songs. I know that will probably turn some of you off immediately, but for everyone else check them out here: http://www.youtube.com/user/astonmusic
In my opinion some of the songs may as well be their own; the arrangements are brilliant. Here's a few favourites of mine: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jIziWfCvNjM -- Khe Sanh by Cold Chisel http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GLpmaWEUobI -- Only girl in the world by Rihanna http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=75FHaGG4a08 -- Born this way by Lady Gaga

item.title: Aston
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I don’t post in here very often, but I came across this group several weeks ago. They’re graduates and soon-to-be graduates from Sydney Australia’s Conservatorium of Music, which is basically the most prestigious music school we have.

So far they’ve done classical arrangements for a number of pop songs. I know that will probably turn some of you off immediately, but for everyone else check them out here:

YouTube

astonmusic

Symphonic versions of POP music. Aston is one of the world’s leading emerging classical groups, turning popular music into symphonic masterpieces. After meet...

In my opinion some of the songs may as well be their own; the arrangements are brilliant.
Here’s a few favourites of mine:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jIziWfCvNjM – Khe Sanh by Cold Chisel
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GLpmaWEUobI – Only girl in the world by Rihanna
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=75FHaGG4a08 – Born this way by Lady Gaga
